values.alignmentText: Microsoft stack appears in finance and government, though Java and web frameworks dominate. Trey and Sarah factor this into balancing remote work with any local tech roles.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries

Seasons are defined by severe volatility with repeated power outages, transportation pauses, or property damage concerns. Seasonal Weather at 5/10 and Natural Disasters at 3/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for seasonal extremes & variability.

Major daylight imbalances demand heavy interventions—SAD lamps, vitamin regimens, and frequent travel for sun exposure. Seasonal Weather at 5/10 and Environment at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for seasonal sunlight hours.

Pleasant stretches appear sporadically, so spontaneous outdoor plans are rare and weather dominates scheduling. Seasonal Weather at 5/10 and Environment at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for pleasant weather windows.

Basic needs are met but savings and extracurriculars are hard to sustain without extra support or side work. Minimum Wage at 6/10, Housing Situation at 4/10, and Childcare Support (Citizens) at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – lower-income tier.

Lifestyle feels brittle; one unexpected expense forces significant cutbacks or debt. Typical Software Salaries at 5/10, Housing Situation at 4/10, and Work-Life Balance at 4/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for quality of life – middle-income tier.

Premium experiences exist but feel overpriced, shallow, or socially frowned upon. Housing Situation at 4/10, Private Education at 5/10, and Family Life at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – higher-income tier.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: Most 2k sq ft options feel overpriced or stuck in fringe neighborhoods with weaker schools. Housing Situation at 4/10 and Cost of Living (Optional) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for spacious housing benchmark (2k sq ft rent).

Intentional communities exist but are limited in size or geared toward niche demographics. Community Vibes at 7/10, Meetups & Communities at 7/10, and Family Life at 6/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for community living opportunities.

Friendliness varies by neighborhood; we can cultivate ties but must invest time and select communities carefully. Community Vibes at 7/10, Meetups & Communities at 7/10, and Common Hobbies at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for friendliness & neighborliness index.

Immigrants are tolerated but face regular microaggressions or bureaucratic hurdles. Welcoming of US Migrants at 7/10, Progressivism at 7/10, and Language & English Ubiquity at 5/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for immigrant sentiment – general.

Noticeable grumbles about expats driving up costs or staying in enclaves; we mitigate by community engagement. Welcoming of US Migrants at 7/10, Language & English Ubiquity at 5/10, and View of Them by Neighboring Countries at 4/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for immigrant sentiment – white migrants.

Politeness is situational; some contexts feel brisk but respectful. Community Vibes at 7/10, Nightlife Culture at 6/10, and Common Hobbies at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for surface interaction norms.

Many acquaintances stay casual, but dedicated outreach unlocks close friendships over time. Community Vibes at 7/10, Meetups & Communities at 7/10, and What Is Intriguing at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for depth-seeking social norms.

Personal space is often compressed, so we must advocate gently for comfort. Community Vibes at 7/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10, and View of self at 8/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for personal boundary & bubble norms.

We balance honesty with cultural nuance to avoid unintentionally offending. Progressivism at 7/10, What Is Intriguing at 8/10, and Trust in Government at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for moral, honesty & openness expectations.

Noticeable emphasis on grooming means we budget extra time and money to fit in. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10 and Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for grooming & beauty investment.

Visible pressure to stay slim or athletic influences work and school culture. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10, Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10, and Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for body image & fitness pressure.

Fashionable appearance is expected in many settings, adding planning time and costs. Fashion Trends (Male) at 6/10 and Fashion Trends (Female) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for fashion & style expectations.

Mixed norms—some groups embrace consent while others rely on outdated assumptions. Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10, LGBTQ+ Attitudes at 8/10, and Nightlife Culture at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for flirting boundaries & consent culture.

Nontraditional approaches face regular pushback or misinterpretation. Gender Roles at 5/10, Gender Fluidity at 5/10, and Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for gendered flirting expectations.

Families risk stigma or legal complications when open about their structure. Polyamory at 2/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10, and Community Vibes at 7/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for monogamy vs. non-monogamy acceptance.

Moralizing comments surface regularly, pushing us to stay private about experiences. Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10, Nightlife & Music at 7/10, and Community Vibes at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for promiscuity attitudes.

Stigma is strong; custody and tenancy agreements become complicated. Polyamory at 2/10, Community Vibes at 7/10, and LGBTQ+ Attitudes at 8/10 steer the family toward a challenging outlook for group & multi-partner relationship attitudes.

Tight quarters and spontaneous touch are common; advocating for space is a regular task. Community Vibes at 7/10, Sex (Attitudes) at 4/10, and Nightlife Culture at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for personal space & touch norms.

Guns are present yet culturally treated as tools with strong safety expectations. Safety & Crime at 9/10, State Ideology at 7/10, and Political System at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for firearm laws & ownership culture.

Balanced approach: regulated markets exist alongside education and support. Progressivism at 7/10, Political System at 8/10, and Safety & Crime at 9/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for controlled substance policies.

Most enforcement is targeted though occasional crackdowns create unease. Safety & Crime at 9/10, Progressivism at 7/10, and Authoritarian Backsliding Risk at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for drug enforcement climate.

Occasional events occur regionally, prompting situational awareness but not chronic fear. Safety & Crime at 9/10 and Stability at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for mass violence incidence.

Conditions are generally decent though some facilities lag in services or transparency. Authoritarian Backsliding Risk at 8/10, Safety & Crime at 9/10, and Perceived Corruption at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for carceral conditions & prison labor.

Sidewalks cover key areas but drivers often rush, so we stay alert with children. Public Transportation at 9/10, Housing Situation at 4/10, and Nature Access at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for walkability & pedestrian safety.

We can find wellness support but must seek out likeminded circles to stay motivated. Healthcare (Citizens) at 9/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Community Vibes at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for community health consciousness.

Processed foods are common but balanced by strong fresh markets. Cost of Living (Optional) at 6/10, Community Health Consciousness at 7/10, and Fresh & International Cuisine Access at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for processed food saturation.

We can meet most cravings but specialty ingredients or restaurants appear sporadically. Nightlife & Music at 7/10, Common Hobbies at 7/10, and Meetups & Communities at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for fresh & international cuisine access.

Stigma or limited providers make it harder to secure consistent care. Seasonal Weather at 5/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Community Vibes at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for depression prevalence.

Higher obesity prevalence indicates limited access to healthy routines in some areas. Community Health Consciousness at 7/10, Work-Life Balance at 4/10, and Cost of Living (Optional) at 6/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for obesity rate.

Slightly elevated incidence prompts routine checkups and monitoring. Environment at 6/10, Healthcare (Citizens) at 9/10, and Community Health Consciousness at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for cancer incidence.

Market depends on a few key industries, so we maintain contingency plans. Economic Health at 8/10, Remote-Friendly Culture at 6/10, and Typical Software Salaries at 5/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for broader job market resilience.
